title: Record 40,000 migrants cross the Chanel this year
description: As France and the UK continue to discuss migrant strategy, the total number of migrants crossings in 2022 has eclipsed the 40,000 mark.

title: Slovenia elects Natasa Pirc Musar to become first female president
description: Liberal rights advocate Natasa Pirc Musar won a runoff Sunday to become Slovenia's first female head of state, and said she will seek to bridge the political division in the Alpine nation of 2 million.

title: Photographing the vestiges of Venezuela
description: In the series 'The Wells Run Dry,' photographer Fabiola Ferrero documented her country's fall into an unprecedented crisis.

title: Death sentence issued in Iran after 'riots'
description: It was the first such sentence since the beginning of the Nationwide unrest has followed the death of Mahsa Amini in police custody.

title: From 'Little Odessa' to 'Armageddon Time,' James Gray surrounds himself with New York ghosts
description: While he now lives in Los Angeles, the 53-year-old filmmaker is unable to fully leave New York, where he shot six of his eight films, including his latest, the extremely autobiographical 'Armageddon Time.'

title: Meet Guillaume Gibault: Founder of Le Slip Français and hardcore 'made in France' promotor
description: At an event dedicated to French manufacturing, the entrepreneur has installed a textile factory 'of the future,' against a backdrop inspired by Daft Punk.

title: Ocean Viking: Why France welcomed the rescue ship and not Italy
description: Italy says France accepted and then retracted its offer to allow the SOS Mediterranée boat to dock in France. Paris in the end decided to adopt a humanitarian stance.

title: Covid-19 revives the debate over 'Frankenviruses'
description: Experts have long been divided on experiments aimed at making pathogens more dangerous, and the issue has become more contentious since the pandemic.

title: Explosion on Istanbul's pedestrian thoroughfare
description: The explosion occurred on Sunday afternoon on Istiklal street, a busy pedestrian street of the Turkish capital.

title: Cricket: England beat Pakistan to win T20 World Cup final
description: England's victory in Australia on Sunday was the country's second tournament crown after its 2010 win.

title: Democrats reassured after retaining Senate majority in midterm elections
description: With the re-election of an incumbent senator from Nevada, the party of US President Joe Biden can wait serenely for the outcome of the remaining seat for Georgia.

title: France and the UK's very different reactions to politicians of color
description: While the appointment of a Black minister of education was critiqued in France, the UK's new prime minister is being heralded as a sign of the country embracing diversity.

title: Netanyahu officially tapped to form Israeli government
description: The long-serving leader's returns to power is expecting to bring about the most right-wing coalition in the country's history.

title: The taco enthusiasts resisting the blasphemy of 'French tacos'
description: In a country where a greasy fast-food sandwich filled with incongruous meats, fries and sauces has been christened a 'taco,' some chefs are striving to restore the dish's dignity..

title: Dissidents ask Macron to 'recognize the voice of the Iranian people' in meeting
description: On Friday, the French head of state received a delegation of women opposed to the regime, as the protest movement continues in Iran.

title: Presidents Biden and Xi will meet to lower tensions
description: The American and Chinese leaders are talking ahead of the G20 summit in Bali, with Taiwan as the main point of contention.

title: Biden huddles with Japan and South Korea in the face of China and North Korea
description: The US president met with the leaders of Japan and South Korea at the East Asia Summit in Cambodia on Sunday. He is to meet China president Xi in Bali on Monday.

title: Autumn Nations Series: France lay down Rugby World Cup marker with South Africa win
description: France's 12th straight victory was sealed with less than two minutes on the clock at the Velodrome on Marseille on Saturday.

title: Latest femicide in Tunisia highlights shortcomings of law to protect women
description: Burned alive by her ex-husband on October 29, Wafa Essbii had applied for a protection order, but it was not enforced – a common issue that lets down the law passed in 2017.

title: Letter from Juba: The rise of South Sudanese models
description: As Majda John Peter wins the prestigious Elite Model Look of the Year contest, her success attests to the growing appreciation of African beauty standards.

title: US: Two historic planes collide during Dallas air show
description: While the number of casualties was not immediately known, 'no spectators or others on the ground were reported injured,' Dallas Mayor Eric Johnson tweeted.

title: Midterm results: Democrats keep Senate majority as GOP push falters in Nevada
description: The fate of the House was still uncertain as the GOP struggled to pull together a slim majority there.

title: Spain grants citizenship to the grandchildren of exiles
description: The Socialist government's new Democratic Memory Law allows descendants of exiles who fled the country during Francisco Franco's dictatorship to apply for Spanish citizenship. An estimated 400,000 people could benefit from it.

title: South Korea is distraught over a declining birth rate
description: In 2021, the population had declined by 91,000 to 51.74 million. Young people there are less and less interested in starting a family, a symptom of deep-seated problems that run through society.
